The purpose of the sequence numbering is only=
 to prevent
collisions on a case-insensitive, case-preserving file system
s=
uch as Macintosh HFS+.  For example, the URL
http://foo.com/bar/z.html will=
 produce the file system path
bar/z.html.  If the URL http://foo.com/BAR/z.=
html then arrives,
the file system path will be BAR1/z.html.  Otherwise, ba=
r and BAR
would be treated as the same directory.

MirrorWriter keeps no st=
ate outside the file system file names.

The URLs you're dealing with have =
query parts that are identical
in the first 300+ characters, which means th=
ey're identical in
the 255 characters of the maximum segment length.

You c=
ould try the following.  First, put back the '?' character
that marks the q=
uery part.  Then, change the code in the
EndSegment constructor to trim out=
 the long substring that's
identical in each query.  It looks something lik=
e

&displayOrder=3DDOCNA,DOCDT,REPNB,DOCTY&callBack=3D&siteName=3DEXTBOD&sT=
ype=3D&report=3D&loan=3D&trustfund=3D&projid=3D&credit=3D&sourceCitation=3D=
&sortDesc=3DDOCDT&dAtts=3DDOCDT,DOCNA,DOCTY,REPNB,LANG,VOLNB,REPNME

That m=
ight get under the 255 character limit.  The code is:

            if (null=
 !=3D query) {
                this.query =3D new LumpyString(query, 0, 
qu=
ery.length(), 0,
                                             this.maxSegLe=
n, 
characterMap,
                                             null);
     =
       }

It would change to:

            if (null !=3D query) {
         =
       this.query =3D new LumpyString(trimQuery(query), 0, 
query.length(),=
 0,
                                             this.maxSegLen, 
character=
Map,
                                             null);
            }

whe=
re trimQuery is a new method you would write to trim out the 
unchanging pa=
rt of the query.
